title: Silver Trade in the Philippines MCQ 1

content.question: Which of the following claims made in the second paragraph would a historian likely cite to demonstrate how European expansion created a truly global economy in the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries?

choices.label: The Chinese emperor could build a palace from all the silver that arrives from Peru.
Many Spanish merchants have successfully avoided paying taxes to the king of Spain.
Merchants of different ethnic groups seek to engage in trade with China.
The ships that Spanish merchants use are often not registered.

content.answer: The Chinese emperor could build a palace from all the silver that arrives from Peru.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and describe a claim or argument in a text-based or non-text-based source.
